intro: Myoxanthus trachychlamys, commonly known as the rough-leaved myoxanthus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and showy, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
